array.text: Germany's defense minister has disbanded a company of special forces, saying a culture of right-wing extremism had been allowed to develop in it behind a "wall of secrecy."

array.title: Europe has limited the rise in unemployment caused by the pandemic
array.text: Europe has limited the rise in unemployment caused by the pandemic with a wide array of government support programs, but that cannot hide widespread economic distress and anxiety among workers and small business owners.

array.title: A major advisory firm is urging Tesla shareholders to remove CEO Elon Musk from the company's board
array.text: A major advisory firm is urging Tesla shareholders to remove CEO Elon Musk from the company's board, citing "a number of concerns" ranging from his erratic Twitter use, his rush to reopen amid COVID-19 and his "excessive" compensation package.

array.text: Novak Djokovic and his wife have tested negative for the coronavirus, his media team says, 10 days after announcing they had contracted the disease.

array.title: Oklahoma became the first state to expand Medicaid Act
array.text: Oklahoma became the first state to expand Medicaid coverage under the Affordable Care Act since the onset of the pandemic.

array.text: "There never was nor shall there be an excuse for the criminal behavior you were subjected to," William Sweeney, assistant director in charge of the FBI's New York Field Office, says to victims at news conference on charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.

array.text: MORE: She has been accused by several women of enabling, facilitating or participating in their abuse. She has previously denied wrongdoing.

array.title: Rights activists accuse Danish officials of being unable to recognize racism
array.text: Rights activists accuse Danish officials of being unable to recognize racism after authorities said the killing of a biracial man by two white men was not racially motivated.

array.title: SDNY officials announce charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.
array.text:
SDNY officials announce charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.
"Maxwell played a critical role in helping Epstein to identify, befriend and groom minor victims for abuse," they allege. "In some cases, Maxwell participated in the abuse."

array.title: The Kremlin appears to have obtained an overwhelming vote in favor of constitutional changes
array.text: The Kremlin appears to have obtained an overwhelming vote in favor of constitutional changes that will allow Russian President Vladimir Putin to remain in power until 2036.

array.title: ACLU joins with law firm to sue Attorney General William Barr
array.text: ACLU joins with law firm to sue Attorney General William Barr and other federal officials in order to delay a federal execution that's scheduled to be carried out later this month, claiming it is unsafe because of coronavirus.

array.title: Scientists put four common variations of face coverings
array.text: Scientists put four common variations of face coverings a bandana, a handkerchief mask, an over-the-counter cone style mask and a two-layer quilting cotton mask under tests to see which ones blocked droplets.

array.title: Officials hold press conference on charges against Ghislaine Maxwell for role in Jeffrey Epstein case.
array.text: Officials hold press conference on charges against Ghislaine Maxwell for role in Jeffrey Epstein case.

array.title: Joe Biden says Pres. Trump is "not even trying to secure the public health anymore."
array.text:
Joe Biden says Pres. Trump is "not even trying to secure the public health anymore."
"He'd rather go back to the campaign rallies  he's decided he has more to gain by dividing this country for his own political purposes."

array.title: Pres. Trump held a press briefing to hail the June jobs report
array.text: Pres. Trump held a press briefing to hail the June jobs report, as economists cautioned that it might not accurately represent the current employment climate.

array.title: "We should have a study of those bases and why they were named,"
array.text: "We should have a study of those bases and why they were named" Scott said.

array.title: CIA Director Gina Haspel led a slate of intelligence officials to the U.S. Capitol
array.text: CIA Director Gina Haspel led a slate of intelligence officials to the U.S. Capitol to brief a select group of lawmakers on reports Russia offered bounties to the Taliban to kill U.S. troops in Afghanistan.

array.title: Two Houston hospitals have begun transporting patients to other cities
array.text: Two Houston hospitals have begun transporting patients to other cities in Texas amid the surge in coronavirus cases.

array.title: Pres. Trump touts new employment numbers showing that 4.8 million jobs were added in June
array.text: Pres. Trump touts new employment numbers showing that 4.8 million jobs were added in June, calling it "spectacular news." Economic experts have said the numbers could be deceiving, showing only a temporary comeback.

array.title: Ghislaine Maxwell, the British socialite who once jet-setted around the world
array.text:
Ghislaine Maxwell, the British socialite who once jet-setted around the world with Jeffrey Epstein, was arrested this morning.
It's not the first time she's found herself in the middle of a global scandal.

array.title: The American Academy of Pediatrics
array.text: The American Academy of Pediatrics "strongly advocates that all policy considerations for the coming school year should start with a goal of having students physically present in school."

array.title: LATEST: In Florida, the number of diagnosed coronavirus cases
array.text: LATEST: In Florida, the number of diagnosed coronavirus cases jumped by 9,558 in one day, now reaching a total of 169,102 cases, according to the state's Department of Health.

array.title: NEW: Joe Biden hits Pres. Trump over European Union's decision to restrict visitors from the U.S.
array.text: NEW: Joe Biden hits Pres. Trump over European Union's decision to restrict visitors from the U.S. amid coronavirus resurgence: "How many times must Americans pay the cost for Donald Trump's failures?"

array.title: NEW: NYC Mayor Bill de Blasio addresses plan for returning to school
array.text: NEW: NYC Mayor Bill de Blasio addresses plan for returning to school in the fall, saying face coverings will be required and schools will implement social distancing, handwashing stations and deep cleaning.

array.title: COVID-19 may have killed 7,000 in assisted living
array.text: COVID-19 may have killed 7,000 in assisted living, congressional report finds.

array.title: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin says the next phase of stimulus
array.text: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin says that the next phase of stimulus relief could include providing funding to schools so they can safely re-open: "I think in most cases schools will be able to open safely. some school will need to spend money."

array.title: Supreme Court agrees to hear arguments over secret grand jury testimony
array.text: Supreme Court agrees to hear arguments over secret grand jury testimony from special counsel Robert Mueller's Russia investigation, keeping documents out of congressional hands at least until case is resolved, which is not likely to happen before 2021.

array.title: Treasury Sec. Steven Mnuchin says Trump is "encouraging" Americans to wear masks
array.text: Treasury Sec. Steven Mnuchin says Trump is "encouraging" Americans to wear masks, but "because he's the president of the United States and people are not around him close and the people who are around are tested, I don't think he needs to wear a mask."

array.title: A new study has found that people who were proactive and stayed home even before lockdown
array.text: A new study has found that people who were proactive and stayed home even before lockdown orders were implemented in the United States may have helped slow the spread of the novel coronavirus back in March and April.

array.title: Maxwell's arrest comes almost exactly one year after the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein.
array.text:
Maxwell's arrest comes almost exactly one year after the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein.
She was taken into custody in Bradford, New Hampshire, without incident and is expected to make a virtual courthouse appearance.

array.title: Authorities in New York seized about $800,000
array.text: Authorities in New York seized about $800,000 worth imported goods from China.

array.title: KABOOM: A fireworks stand in Texas caught fire
array.text: KABOOM: A fireworks stand in Texas caught fire, setting off a display for passing motorists.

array.title: After making remarks about job numbers and the economy
array.text: After making remarks about job numbers and the economy, Pres. Trump leaves the White House briefing room without taking questions from reporters.

array.title: Pres. Trump: "State officials will decide how rapidly to open their economics"
array.text: Pres. Trump: "State officials will decide how rapidly to open their economics that's largely up to them. If we see something that's egregious, we've gotten involved with a couple of them ... we'd like to see churches open quickly."

array.title: Pres. Trump predicts that "you're going to have a fantastic third quarter.."
array.text: Pres. Trump predicts that "you're going to have a fantastic third quarter...and the good thing is the numbers will be coming out just prior to the election, so people will be able to see those numbers."

array.title: Another 1.4 million workers filed
array.text: MORE: Another 1.4 million workers filed for unemployment insurance in the last week.

array.title: Miami cop relieved of duty after a video
array.text: Miami cop relieved of duty after video shows him appearing to punch a woman in the face.
